Posts.Content: GigiBC318 wrote:  Hoping for some help.  I have IDC DCIS diagnosis, ER+, PR+ Her2-, nodes are negative,    BUT I have LVI (lymphatic vascular invasion present in the tumor)  I just went for radiation consult and because I have LVI  he lengthened my radiaition from 7-12 treatment course to 21 treatments.  The medical oncology consult said no to chemo since my Oncotype test score was a 16.  I'll do hormone therapy defiantly for at least 5 years.  If it helps, I'm 53 and post menopausal.  Anyone else experience this?????    Thank you!!! Dx 4/2/2018, DCIS/IDC, Right, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (IHC) Radiation Therapy 8/3/2018 Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes, Chest wall Hormonal Therapy 10/12/2018 Femara (letrozole) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How long should radiation treatment be stage 1 with LVI? GigiBC318 GigiBC318

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2018 01:31PM GigiBC318 wrote: Hi NJGal I'm doing ok and finding my "normal" again.  Thanks for asking.  I'll try to be of help.  I hope your 1st MO appt went well.   I ended up having 21 treatments of radiation that was from my collar bone to under my breast, over to my sternum to under my arm; face down.  The last 5 of the 21 were called "boost" treatments where the area where the tumor was found and removed was the target.  Due to the LVI I had more treatments.  I am currently taking my oral hormone inhibitor (almost two weeks now). If you'd like to know more about my experience with my treatments please ask whatever you'd like.  I feel mine was pretty tame and although I had some skin side affects and a little fatigue the treatments and side affects were bearable and not too bad.
